content.question: The English horn and French horn both sound a perfect fifth lower than written. Which of the following correctly shows the sounding pitches played by the instruments?

choices.label: The figure presents one measure of music on a grand staff with two stacks of three half notes. The top staff is in treble clef and the bottom staff is bass clef. The key signature has one flat.
The figure presents one measure of music on a grand staff with two stacks of three half notes. The top staff is in treble clef and the bottom staff is bass clef. The key signature has one flat.
The figure presents one measure of music on a grand staff with two stacks of three half notes. The top staff is in treble clef and the bottom staff is bass clef. The key signature has one flat.
The figure presents one measure of music on a grand staff with two stacks of three half notes. The top staff is in treble clef and the bottom staff is bass clef. The key signature has one flat.

content.answer: The figure presents one measure of music on a grand staff with two stacks of three half notes. The top staff is in treble clef and the bottom staff is bass clef. The key signature has one flat.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
